data_usage: A time series of annual temperature anomalies for the midwestern U.S. from 1895 to 2012 were plotted with a trend line.
methodology: Annual mean temperatures were averaged for all grid points in the midwestern U.S. Temperature anomalies were then calculated by subtracting the 1901-1960 average temperature from the annual average temperatures and plotted as a time series from 1895 to 2012. The temperature trend for the entire period was also calculated using linear least squares regression, and plotted as a trend line.
